title: Repo sync
author: docs-bot
details: Introduces enterprise-level GitHub App installations, allowing apps to be installed directly on enterprise accounts with specific enterprise permissions.
Adds the role of "GitHub App manager" at the enterprise level, enabling delegated app management without full owner privileges.
Updates app creation and management workflows to support enterprise installations, including permission handling and visibility rules.
Documents limitations for enterprise-installed apps (e.g., no webhook support, restricted API access).
Enhances Actions secrets management by granting "Write and Maintain" access levels during updates.
Includes workflow artifacts data in migration documentation.
summary:
- Introduces enterprise-level GitHub App installations, allowing apps to be installed directly on enterprise accounts with specific enterprise permissions.
- Adds the role of "GitHub App manager" at the enterprise level, enabling delegated app management without full owner privileges.
- Updates app creation and management workflows to support enterprise installations, including permission handling and visibility rules.
- Documents limitations for enterprise-installed apps (e.g., no webhook support, restricted API access).
- Enhances Actions secrets management by granting "Write and Maintain" access levels during updates.
- Includes workflow artifacts data in migration documentation.
generated_title: Enterprise GitHub App Management: Installations and App Managers

original_description:
This is an automated pull request to sync changes between the public and private repos.
Our bot will merge this pull request automatically.
To preserve continuity across repos, _do not squash_ this pull request.
raw_analysis:
### Summary
- Introduces enterprise-level GitHub App installations, allowing apps to be installed directly on enterprise accounts with specific enterprise permissions.
- Adds the role of "GitHub App manager" at the enterprise level, enabling delegated app management without full owner privileges.
- Updates app creation and management workflows to support enterprise installations, including permission handling and visibility rules.
- Documents limitations for enterprise-installed apps (e.g., no webhook support, restricted API access).
- Enhances Actions secrets management by granting "Write and Maintain" access levels during updates.
- Includes workflow artifacts data in migration documentation.

### Title
Enterprise GitHub App Management: Installations and App Managers
